intro: Pycreus cimicinus, commonly known as the southern sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, fleshy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the cooler months. Pycreus cimicinus is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland dune environments.
